definition: to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
lit. to punch and kick (idiom); to beat up/fig. determined to sort out a problem

sentences.english: The black stitching around the toe box gives the shoe a good punch.
sentences.chinese: 黑缝在脚趾箱子附近给鞋子好拳打。

sentences.english: Fixed server hitching when client is kicked for inactivity.

sentences.english: That led to another fist fight.
sentences.chinese: 这又引起了另一场拳打脚踢。

sentences.english: See period that come to those people's buffet ugg boots hit, ugg boots something took arms.
sentences.chinese: 看来那些人拳打脚踢的时候，还有人拿了兵刃。

sentences.english: Children’s furniture must withstand kicks and blows.

definition: to swing (one's arms, a heavy object)/to wave (a sword, one's fists)/to fling (money)
to beat with the fist/to hammer/to cudgel
hand formed into a flat shape, as for a karate chop
with all one's might/with sudden force/violently/to slam
